Class RandomMooValue

java.lang.Object
RandomMooValue
public class RandomMooValue
extends java.lang.Object
Creates a four-digit secret value (between 0000 and 9999) to be guessed by the player.
For each digit correctly guessed in both position and value, the program will output "MOO!"
For each digit correctly guessed in only value, the program will output "moo".
If neither position nor value is correctly guessed, the program will play a cowbell sound.
Since:
27 January 2021
Author:
Wyatt Fisher

  • Constructor Details

    • RandomMooValue

      public RandomMooValue()
      Creates a new RandomMooValue object containing a secret value to be guessed.

  • Method Details

    • setSecretValue

      public boolean setSecretValue()
      Generates a new secret value to be guessed in a game of LaurieMOO.
      Returns:
      true in all cases.

    • setSecretValue

      public boolean setSecretValue​(int n)
      Sets the "secret" value to be guessed in a game of LaurieMOO to a known 4-digit quantity. Used for testing purposes only.
      Parameters:
      n - The number to be set as the secret number, as long as it is between 0000-9999, inclusive.
      Returns:
      true if secret value was reset; false if passed value was outside allowed range.

    • getSecretValue

      public int getSecretValue()
      Access the value that the user is trying to guess. Mainly used to show the user what the number was after the game ends.
      Returns:
      the secret value that the player was trying to guess.

    • getBigMooCount

      public int getBigMooCount​(int guess)
      The number of digits in the user's guess that exactly (i.e., same position) matches digits in the secret value.
      Parameters:
      guess - The number the player guessed.
      Returns:
      a number 0-4 representing the number of digits the player guessed correctly in the correct position.

    • getLittleMooCount

      public int getLittleMooCount​(int guess)
      The number of digits in the user's guess that match digits in the secret value, but are not at the same position.
      Parameters:
      guess - The number the player guessed.
      Returns:
      a number 0-4 representing the number of digits the player guessed correctly but in the wrong position.

    • isCorrectGuess

      public boolean isCorrectGuess​(int guess)
      Determines if the user correctly guessed the secret value.
      Parameters:
      guess - The number that the user guessed. -1 will be passed to reset the guess count when the random button is pressed.
      Returns:
      true if the guess is correct, false otherwise.

    • getNumberOfGuesses

      public int getNumberOfGuesses()
      Gets the number of guesses the player has entered.
      Returns:
      the number of guesses the player has tried.

    • formatSecretValue

      public java.lang.String formatSecretValue​(int value)
      Adds leading zeroes to the secret value if it is less than four digits.
      Parameters:
      value - The secret value to be formatted.
      Returns:
      the string version of the formatted secret value.

    • setPlayerGuess

      public void setPlayerGuess​(int guess)
      Sets the private variable playerGuess to the integer the player guesses.
      Parameters:
      guess - The integer the player guessed.

    • getPlayerGuess

      public int getPlayerGuess()
      Returns the player's guess as an integer.
      Returns:
      the player's guess as an integer
